data.title: Scott Conard, MD on LinkedIn: Stacey tells the story better than I can. I hope everyone into value basedâ€¦
data.meta_description: Stacey tells the story better than I can. I hope everyone into value based care and advanced primary care can learn from my mistakes and life lessons to moveâ€¦
data.text:
Hereâ€™s a great musing that I read on LinkedIn: How will alternative primary care models fare when growth mode gets balanced with profitability and VC-supported burn rate is transformed to Big Retail bottom-line expectations? Mission v. margin. (from a great post by Benjamin Schwartz, MD, MBA - link in show notes.) Iâ€™m gonna add to this: How will alternative primary care models, or even just doing good primary care, fare when it encounters the current system rife with perverse incentives of all kinds, including Big Retail bottom-line expectations but also Big Health System and Big Payer bottom-line expectations and current business models? This show from last year was wildly popularâ€”maybe one of our most popular showsâ€”and relisten to it in the current context of whatâ€™s going on right now in the primary care and MSO (Managed Services Only) space. Coming up, Iâ€™m gonna probably do a whole show on this if I can get my act together; but this encore is really relevant right now. Also mentioned in this #healthcarepodcast: Scott Conard, MD; David Muhlestein, PhD, JD; Brian Klepper, PhD; Al Lewis ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¦; Robert Pearl, M.D.; Karen Root, MBA, CCXP; Wendell Potter Click to read the full article on the RHV Web site and listen to the Relentless Health Value Podcast: https://lnkd.in/e8j9uaDM

What is the future of healthcare as retail health and traditional health systems battle it out? Whoâ€™s winning and what does this mean for the healthcare consumer? Join James A. Gardner, Director, Healthcare Strategy, at OHO Interactive and host Alan Tam as they explore and discuss the future of primary care, whatâ€™s motivating these giants, what moves theyâ€™ve already made, and what might happen next. Retail health leaders like Walgreens, CVS Health, Walmart, Amazon, and Dollar General are remaking primary care with their ambitious plans to deliver at-scale health and wellness services. For traditional care delivery organizations, risks and opportunities are abound in this fast-changing landscape. This conversation is brought to you by Actium Health in partnership with the Forum for Healthcare Strategists. #hmps23 #healthcaremarketing #hellohealthcare #podcast #healthcare #healthcarestrategy Listen on your favorite podcast app.

The other problem we are taking up in this healthcare podcast as it relates to healthcare delivery organizations who have rolled up or consolidated and are led with centralized control is the Diversification Discount. The Diversification Discount is actually a Wall Street word, and it means that companies doing a whole bunch of different things might wind up with a lower stock price than companies who do one thing really well or only do things that have the same business model. Also mentioned in this #healthcarepodcast: David Muhlestein, PhD, JD; Brian Klepper, PhD; Stacy Mays, MBA; Peter Hayes; Robert Pearl, MD; John Lee, MD; Kate Wolin, ScD; Jodilyn Owen; Hoangmai (Mai) Pham, MD; Ann Kempski; Kara Swisher; Scott Galloway, MBA Click to read the full article on the RHV Web site and listen to the #healthcarepodcast w/Stacey Richter: https://cc-lnk.com/EP440

IT'S HERE. Wei-Li Shao, President of Omada Health, joins us to discuss Omada's big splash: being named Amazonâ€™s first partner for their new Health Condition programs for managing chronic conditions. Wei-Li shares how this partnership is keeping the human element of healthcare front and center, and how designing experiences outside of the doctorâ€™s office is leading to real behavior change at scale. All that, plus the Flava of the Week about Best Buy Healthâ€™s year in review. Which of their highlights slipped under the radar in 2023, and what are they showing us by doubling down on home health and consumer wellness products? Subscribe on your favorite podcasting platform or listen using the links in the comments below. #consumerhealth #healthcaretransformation #healthcare #podcast #digitalhealth #retailhealth Shift Forward Health Zain Ismail James A. Gardner Mitch Holdwick

Bookmark This Post! | CVS Health Today, Jared Johnson, James A. Gardner, and I had a lovely and insightful conversation with Creagh Milford, DO, MPH, Vice President of Retail Health Services at CVS Health on the Healthcare Rap Podcast. Dr. Milford talked us through the ins and outs of "retail health," explained how CVS Health is partnering with health systems nationwide, and how the organization thinks about putting health consumers first. The episode drops in a couple of weeks. Bookmark this post, and we will drop you the link when the episode goes live. #podcast #healthcare #innovation #retailhealth

7 stories we are following at Becker Private Equity and Business Podcast. 1. Starbucks dropped 16% yesterday and had its worst day in the market in years. "The company missed on all metrics (revenue, earnings, and same-store sales), with foot traffic declining across the globe." Yahoo Finance. 2. CVS Health also got trounced yesterday with its stock down 17%. After plans feasted on Medicare Advantage the last couple of years, this area is getting a lot tougher. 3. The markets soared after Chairman Powell spoke. Then the markets gave back all of their gains and then some by the end of the day. Currently futures point up today. 4. Apple reports earnings after the bell today. 5. Job openings are decreasing in the US. This ultimately has the potential to bring down wage inflation and also move the Fed on rates. Not yet but this will help. 6. Walmart Health threw in the towel on more core health care clinics. See number 7. 7. Many of the big disruptors in health care are learning what we all know. There aren't enough doctors, stupid. Listen to this short podcast at either Becker Private Equity and Business Podcast or the Becker's Healthcare podcast.

Diving into Value-Based Care! This afternoon, we had a lovely conversation with Dr. Bartley Bryt and Mark Foulke from Privia Health. We spent most of the show talking about the ins and outs of value-based care arrangements, what is essential for physician practices to get right, and how technology is only part of that solution. Also, did you know that CMS will require ALL their covered lives to be in value-based arrangements by 2030? That sounds like a massive call to action; what do you think, Jared Johnson? #healthcare #podcast #valuebased #innovation
